law.text:
On the payment to the board of fees required by this chapter and on submission of a written application on forms provided by the board, the board shall issue a license to:
A person who presents evidence satisfactory to the board of being a registered occupational therapist or a certified occupational therapy assistant through the National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy or its equivalent, and who has met the academic and fieldwork requirements of KRS 319A.110 and the examination requirement of KRS 319A.120; or
A person who presents evidence satisfactory to the board of being currently licensed, certified, or registered as an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant by another state, territory of the United States, or the District of Columbia, where the requirements for licensure, registration, or certification are equal to or greater than the requirements set forth in this chapter.
law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 9, effective July 15, 2002. -- Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 78, sec. 14, effective July 15, 1986.
